thread.title: Police: Marshawn Lynch Not in Street Race with Fred Jackson
thread.title_full: Police: Marshawn Lynch Not in Street Race with Fred Jackson

title: Police: Marshawn Lynch Not in Street Race with Fred Jackson
text:
Police: Marshawn Lynch Not in Street Race with Fred Jackson - SWX Right Now-Sports for Spokane, CdA, Tri-Cities, WA Member Center: Police: Marshawn Lynch Not in Street Race with Fred Jackson Posted: According to TMZ, Marshawn Lynch was racing teammate Fred Jackson before Jackson crashed his car into a stop sign. 
Update: Early reports of Seahawks running backs Fred Jackson and Marshawn Lynch being involved in a crash following a street race are false according to police. 
Just before 5 p.m. Tuesday evening, Jackson was involved in a crash after losing control of his Corvette and hit a street sign. The car sustained damage, but Jackson appeared uninjured but was evaluated by team personnel. 
Police say there is no indication that Jackson was racing another vehicle. He remained on the scene until officers could speak to him and was cooperative. 
Previous coverage: 
Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson crashed his car while racing teammate Marshawn Lynch on Tuesday, according to a report from TMZ. 
Jackson reportedly crashed into a stop sign near the Virginia Mason Athletic Center, the team's practice facility. Witnesses told TMZ that Jackson and Lynch were racing as they left practice. 
Bob Condotta of The Seattle Times confirmed that it was Jackson driving the car, but a team source told Condotta that Jackson was fine after the accident. Report: Street Race Involving Seahawks RBs Lynch, Jackson Ends in Crash According to TMZ, Marshawn Lynch was racing teammate Fred Jackson before Jackson crashed his car into a stop sign. Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson crashed his car while racing teammate Marshawn Lynch on Tuesday, according to a report from TMZ. Jackson reportedly crashed into a stop sign near the Virginia Mason Athletic Center, the team's practice facility. Witnesses told TMZ that Jackson and Lynch were racing as they left practice. More >> Seahawks Blow Another 4th Quarter Lead, Fall to Panthers 27-23 The Seahawks fall to 2-4 on the season after Sunday's 27-23 loss to Carolina. Some late heroics from Cam Newton showed that the Carolina Panthers being unbeaten is no fluke.Winning on the home field of the two-time NFC champions sure proved it.Newton threw a 26-yard touchdown pass to Greg Olsen with 32 seconds left and the Panthers moved to 5-0, rallying for a stunning 27-23 win over the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday. The Seattle Seahawks have suspended fullback Derrick Coleman indefinitely pending further information about his arrest Wednesday night. He is under investigation of vehicular assault and felony hit-and-run. More >> Strange Late Sequence Gives Seattle 13-10 Win Over Detroit Kam Chancellor made a great defensive play that was overshadowed by a controversial one. (Photo: NBC on SNF) SEATTLE (AP) -- Kam Chancellor saw the ball exposed and threw a punch. By knocking the ball free from Calvin Johnson, Chancellor may have created a wild swing in where the Seattle Seahawks will finish this season and provided another bit of officiating controversy on a Monday night in Seattle. "It's good to have Kam back. To have him make that play was pretty cool," Seattle quarterback Russell Wilson said. Chancellor punched the ball free as Johnson was about to score... More >> Lynch, Mebane Downgraded to 'Out' for Monday Night Game vs. Lions Marshawn Lynch has been downgraded to 'out' for the Seahawks Monday night game. SEATTLE (AP) - The Seattle Seahawks have downgraded running back Marshawn Lynch and defensive tackle Brandon Mebane to out for Monday night's game against the Detroit Lions. Seattle announced the changes in status following the team's walkthrough practice on Sunday. Lynch and Mebane had both been listed as questionable after Saturday's final practice. More >> SEATTLE (AP) - The Seattle Seahawks have downgraded running back Marshawn Lynch and defensive tackle Brandon Mebane to out for Monday night's game against the Detroit Lions. Seattle announced the changes in status following the team's walkthrough practice on Sunday. Lynch and Mebane had both been listed as questionable after Saturday's final practice. More >> Lockett Return Ignites Seattle As Seahawks Pick Up First Win, 26-0 Over Chicago SEATTLE (AP) -- One burst of speed from rookie Tyler Lockett ignited Russell Wilson, Jimmy Graham and the rest of the Seattle Seahawks after a sleepy start against Chicago. Lockett returned the second-half kickoff 105 yards for a touchdown, Wilson and Graham connected on a 30-yard TD in the third quarter, and the Seahawks routed the undermanned Bears 26-0 on Sunday. Seattle led just 6-0 at halftime after an offensive performance that led to a cascade of boos.
